did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library
did.physdesc: This collection consists of one manuscript record book.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Great Britain. Naval Office, Record book, 1777-1799, Accession # 10927, Special Collections Dept., University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The register was purchased by the Library from Joseph J. Felcone, Inc. of Princeton, New Jersey, on March 22, 1990.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This manuscript record book entitled "A List of His Majestys Navy, Shewing the Dimensions and Age of every Ship therein. Navy Office, 1st. June 1777" is a contemporary annotated inventory of the ships in the British navy during the American Revolution. It is an oblong octavo of thirty pages, stitched in plain brown wrappers.

Written in columnar form, the names of approximately four hundred ships are followed by their rate, length of gun deck, length of keel, breadth, depth of hold, number of guns, weight, number of men, and when and where each ship was built. Following each entry is a space for remarks, and, in different hands, is recorded the fate of many of the vessels, changes in guns, and other comments, until about the year 1799. The final two leaves contain "An Accurate List of the Kings Ships of War Lost, taken, or destroyed since June 1776," followed by the ship's number of guns and a statement concerning its loss, which usually occurred in America.
